criteria.name: Artifact description
criteria.description: describes the proposed artifact in adequate detail

criteria.name: Justification
criteria.description: justifies the need for, usefulness of, or relevance of the proposed artifact

criteria.name: Limitations
criteria.description: conceptually evaluates the artifact; discusses its strengths, weaknesses and limitations

criteria.name: State-of-art
criteria.description:
EITHER: discusses state-of-art alternatives (and their strengths, weaknesses and limitations)
OR: explains why no state-of-art alternatives exist
OR: provides compelling argument that direct comparisons are impractical

criteria.name: Evaluation
criteria.description:
Empirically evaluates the proposed artifact using:
action research, in which the researchers intervene a real organization using the artifact,
a case study in which a real organization uses the artifact without researcher intervention,
a controlled experiment in which human participants use the artifact,
a simulation in which the artifact is used in an artificial environment, or
another method for which a clear and convincing rationale is provided

criteria.name: Methodology description
criteria.description: clearly indicates the empirical methodology being used (e.g. action research, controlled experiment)

criteria.name: Comparison
criteria.description:
EITHER: empirically compares the artifact to one or more state-of-the-art alternative artifacts
OR: empirically compares the artifact to one or more state-of-the-art benchmarks
OR: provides a clear and convincing rationale for why comparative evaluation is impractical

criteria.name: Assumptions
criteria.description:
assumptions (if any) are explicit; do not contradict each other or the contributionâ€™s goals; plausibly
hold for the evaluation subjects

criteria.name: Notation
criteria.description: uses notation consistently (if any notation is used)

criteria.name: Theoretical basis
criteria.description: reviews the theoretical basis of the artifact

criteria.name: Arguments
criteria.description:
provides correctness arguments of the key analytical and theoretical contributions (e.g. theorems,
complexity analyses, mathematical proofs)

criteria.name: Running example
criteria.description: includes one or more running examples to elucidate the artifact

criteria.name: Replication package
criteria.description:
provides a replication package including datasets and analytical scripts and EITHER a
comprehensive description of the artifact OR source code if artifact is virtual

criteria.name: Replication justification
criteria.description: justifies any items missing from replication package based on practical or ethical grounds.

criteria.name: Contribution
criteria.description: contributes to our collective understanding of design practices or principles

criteria.name: Innovation
criteria.description: the paper presents ground-breaking innovations with obvious real-world benefits
